snippet.textDisplay: There are a few exceptions. Mario and Luigi: Dream Team has been pretty good for me. Its a lot better than Sticker Star and I like the new designs of the characters. It reminds me of Super Mario RPG. :)
snippet.textOriginal: There are a few exceptions. Mario and Luigi: Dream Team has been pretty good for me. Its a lot better than Sticker Star and I like the new designs of the characters. It reminds me of Super Mario RPG. :)

snippet.textDisplay: I know, I'm definitely in the minority. What really made it the best for me was the storyline and the music (and Dimentio, of course!). I have to agree, though, that as fun as Sticker Star was, it was definitely a disappointment to it's series. I would say the same about Super Mario 3D Land. I liked it, but I didn't think it was nearly as good as the rest of the 3D platformer series. So far the 3DS hasn't produced great sequels (save for LMDM) Hopefully SSB4 is another exception.
snippet.textOriginal: I know, I'm definitely in the minority. What really made it the best for me was the storyline and the music (and Dimentio, of course!). I have to agree, though, that as fun as Sticker Star was, it was definitely a disappointment to it's series. I would say the same about Super Mario 3D Land. I liked it, but I didn't think it was nearly as good as the rest of the 3D platformer series. So far the 3DS hasn't produced great sequels (save for LMDM) Hopefully SSB4 is another exception.

snippet.textDisplay:
Dayum, Super Paper Mario first?! Wow, I actually hadn't heard that before. I still love that game though. An amazing story with great visuals and superb music, along with fun gameplay. It will always have a place in my heart. 

For Sticker Star, however, it was a disappointment. I wouldn't say Epic Mickey 1 or 2 disappointment, but still, it could have been so much more. :(
snippet.textOriginal:
Dayum, Super Paper Mario first?! Wow, I actually hadn't heard that before. I still love that game though. An amazing story with great visuals and superb music, along with fun gameplay. It will always have a place in my heart. 

For Sticker Star, however, it was a disappointment. I wouldn't say Epic Mickey 1 or 2 disappointment, but still, it could have been so much more. :(

snippet.textDisplay: Nah, the graphics aren't amazing, they didn't strain the hardware much; no one is going to confuse it for realism. what it has is an amazing *aesthetic.* The colours and style make it fun to look at and play.
snippet.textOriginal: Nah, the graphics aren't amazing, they didn't strain the hardware much; no one is going to confuse it for realism. what it has is an amazing *aesthetic.* The colours and style make it fun to look at and play.

snippet.textDisplay:
I've heard that Shigeru Miyamoto deliberately made Sticker Star have a worse story than originally planned. Intelligent Systems were actually working on this game as a port of the Gamecube version, so it was supposed to be destined to be a sequel of sorts.. Mr. Miyamoto actually called it "boring". I dunno about that guy sometimes, even considering other games he's helped made..

I'd probly say otherwise if this wasn't my favorite series of games ever.
snippet.textOriginal:
I've heard that Shigeru Miyamoto deliberately made Sticker Star have a worse story than originally planned. Intelligent Systems were actually working on this game as a port of the Gamecube version, so it was supposed to be destined to be a sequel of sorts.. Mr. Miyamoto actually called it "boring". I dunno about that guy sometimes, even considering other games he's helped made..

I'd probly say otherwise if this wasn't my favorite series of games ever.

I remember one day just playing it for hours on end :')

snippet.textDisplay:
@smbz1 
I love the original Paper Mario more because of its soundtrack. It had a lot more lively themes than The Thousand Year Door. Plus, I have a lot more fond memories of the original Paper Mario. I played through it like 3-4 times. I loved it that much. Hopefully, Paper Mario 3DS will have just as good a soundtrack as the original Paper Mario.
snippet.textOriginal:
@smbz1 
I love the original Paper Mario more because of its soundtrack. It had a lot more lively themes than The Thousand Year Door. Plus, I have a lot more fond memories of the original Paper Mario. I played through it like 3-4 times. I loved it that much. Hopefully, Paper Mario 3DS will have just as good a soundtrack as the original Paper Mario.

snippet.textDisplay: Nothing will beat the feeling of beating that bitch hooktail and getting that first crystal star. This song makes that moment so good, I just sat back and listened to this theme for so long. A masterful piece for a masterful game.

snippet.textDisplay:
Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door is the best RPG I've ever played.
The atmosphere, music, characters... it's all quite astounding.

The final boss fight was - and I don't this word often because it is overused, but in this case it's justified - EPIC. And this tune is awesome.
snippet.textOriginal:
Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door is the best RPG I've ever played.
The atmosphere, music, characters... it's all quite astounding.

The final boss fight was - and I don't this word often because it is overused, but in this case it's justified - EPIC. And this tune is awesome.

snippet.textDisplay:
Lol @ All the people whining about Super Paper Mario in the comments.

For crying out loud, people. A game shouldn't be condemned for being different. Super Paper Mario is a great, great game. It's sad that so many people deem it to be a bad game just because it's a platformer.
snippet.textOriginal:
Lol @ All the people whining about Super Paper Mario in the comments.

For crying out loud, people. A game shouldn't be condemned for being different. Super Paper Mario is a great, great game. It's sad that so many people deem it to be a bad game just because it's a platformer.

snippet.textDisplay: I think it's because people think it's supposed to be Paper Mario 3.
snippet.textOriginal: I think it's because people think it's supposed to be Paper Mario 3.

snippet.textDisplay:
Super Paper Mario has to be the most underrated game of all time. It's an absolutely brilliant action RPG. It's such a shame to see everyone here hating the game. So what if it isn't turn-based? It was trying something different, and perhaps if some of you stopped whining about it, maybe you'd see it's an excellent, excellent game.

I know I'm in for 6 thumbs down or more, and I apologize if I was blunt, but I just felt Super paper Mario needed a defender. Forgive me.
snippet.textOriginal:
Super Paper Mario has to be the most underrated game of all time. It's an absolutely brilliant action RPG. It's such a shame to see everyone here hating the game. So what if it isn't turn-based? It was trying something different, and perhaps if some of you stopped whining about it, maybe you'd see it's an excellent, excellent game.

I know I'm in for 6 thumbs down or more, and I apologize if I was blunt, but I just felt Super paper Mario needed a defender. Forgive me.

snippet.textDisplay: I forgot how great this piece of music was/still is. This game had quite a large supply of amazing piece of music. Most of the boss battle music was very memorable, and just when you thought there wasn't a piece that could top your favorite. The game would suprise you with even better music. You could basically just put the whole game down in your list "Best VGM".

I forgot how amazing this song is!
I love the Paper Mario series so much... I can't really pick a favorite out of any of them, but the second one is the most fun to play.
My favorite songs from this game were the file load theme, and the Doopliss and Smorg battle themes.
